content.description: Sit start on a sidepull and broken inclusion, and climb a dark waterstreak to a juggy topout.
content.location: It ascends a black water streak on a slightly overhanging face.

content.description: This is a tall, slightly overhung boulder problem with great moves and a dicey top-out. Sit start far right and work left, then up. Avoid using the "crack" far left and stay on the main prow of the boulder.
content.location: This is directly up and across the road from The Falls parking lot. Walk the road about 30 yards towards the entrance, then head directly up the hill to your left. The boulder sit obviously all alone with a perfect landing amongst wood chips. It is only about 20 yards uphill. This problem was exposed after the park cleared scrubs all along the back entrance road.

content.description: Start sitting with a high pinch, sort your feet, and pull off. Stick to the pocketed face. Top out the short, overhanging face on okay inclusions. This includes two bomber pocks.
content.location: It climbs the left side of a slightly overhanging face. Two deep pockets midway up identify this climb.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
